alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Bexar; Kendall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 29 at 4:49PM CDT until May 29 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Bandera County in south central Texas... Northwestern Bexar County in south central Texas... Southwestern Kendall County in south central Texas... * Until 745 PM CDT. * At 449 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 2.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... San Antonio, Boerne, Comfort, Bandera, Fair Oaks Ranch, Cross Mountain, Kronkosky State Natural Area, Pipe Creek, Nelson City, Bandera Falls, Walnut Grove, Welfare, Lakehills, Kreutzberg, San Geronimo, Cascade Caverns, Lake Medina Shores and Scenic Oaks. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
